![Daecheong Dam (ÎåÄÏ≤≠Îåê)](/2022-07-27-1658890608788/1597032_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Daecheong Dam is a multi-purpose dam consisting of a 72 meter-tall and 495 meter-long concrete gravity dam and rockfill dam. It is located on the Geumgang River where Daejeon and Chungcheongbuk-do meet. There are three additional support dams in the area of the main dam to help control the river's flow. The dam also serves as a power source for the nearby areas of Daejeon and Cheongju. Construction of the dam took nearly six years, started in March 1975 and completed in 1980.

The observatory, located at Palgakjeong Service Area, offers a great view of Daecheongho Lake. A variety of fascinating items are displayed in the Water Culture Center on the left bank of Daecheong Dam. A nearby grassy meadow promises a relaxing and comfortable rest, while local delicacies such as spicy fish stew using freshwater fish and marinated grilled eel are a delight to taste. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|‚Ä¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
‚Ä¢ For more info: +82-43-930-7332| |parking:|Available| |restdate:|[Daecheong Dam Water Culture Center] Mondays, New Year's Day, the day of Seollal (Lunar New Year's Day) & Chuseok (Korean Thanksgiving Day)| |usetime:|[Daecheong Dam Water Culture Center] 10:00-17:00 (* Last admission 16:50)| ## Detail Image ![/2022-07-27-1658890608788/1597028_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-27-1658890608788/1597028_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-27-1658890608788/1597029_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-27-1658890608788/1597029_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-27-1658890608788/1597030_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-27-1658890608788/1597030_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-27-1658890608788/1597031_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-27-1658890608788/1597031_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-27-1658890608788/1597033_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-27-1658890608788/1597033_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-27-1658890608788/1597034_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-27-1658890608788/1597034_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-27-1658890608788/1690693_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-27-1658890608788/1690693_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-27-1658890608788/1690694_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-27-1658890608788/1690694_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-27-1658890608788/1690695_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-27-1658890608788/1690695_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-27-1658890608788/1690696_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-27-1658890608788/1690696_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [‚òéÔ∏è+82-43-930-7332](tel:+82439307332) - [üè†www.kwater.or.kr](https://www.kwater.or.kr/cust/sub02/sub02/sub03/tour19Page.do?s_mid=1072) ```googleMap latitude: 36.4745086975 longitude: 127.4815643393 title: 618-136, Daecheong-ro, Daedeok-gu, Daejeon ```

data.title: Daecheong Dam (ÎåÄÏ≤≠Îåê)
data.description:
Daecheong Dam is a multi-purpose dam consisting of a 72 meter-tall and 495 meter-long concrete gravity dam and rockfill dam. It is located on the Geumgang River where Daejeon and Chungcheongbuk-do meet. There are three additional support dams in the area of the main dam to help control the river's flow. The dam also serves as a power source for the nearby areas of Daejeon and Cheongju. Construction of the dam took nearly six years, started in March 1975 and completed in 1980.

The observatory, located at Palgakjeong Service Area, offers a great view of Daecheongho Lake. A variety of fascinating items are displayed in the Water Culture Center on the left bank of Daecheong Dam. A nearby grassy meadow promises a relaxing and comfortable rest, while local delicacies such as spicy fish stew using freshwater fish and marinated grilled eel are a delight to taste.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jangnyeongsan Recreational Forest (Ïû•Î†πÏÇ∞ÏûêÏó∞Ìú¥ÏñëÎ¶º)
dataList.description: Jangnyeongsan Mountain is noted for its beautiful scenery embracing pine trees, maple trees, and cypress trees. It is popular in the fall due to its stunning autumn foliage. The forest spans 3.1 kilometers and consists of a garden, wooden bridge, and wishing rock and offers a variety of forest retreat programs. The forest is also noted for Geumcheongyegok Valley and its clear waters. Convenience facilities in the park include an outdoor music stage, seminar rooms, campsite, a convenience store, and lodging facilities.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Gyemyeongsan Recreational Forest (Í≥ÑÎ™ÖÏÇ∞ÏûêÏó∞Ìú¥ÏñëÎ¶º)
dataList.description:
Gyemyeongsan Recreational Forest is located on Gyemyeongsan Mountain, part of the Sobaeksan Mountain Range, and has outstanding views of Chungjugho Lake. Although the park is small in size, the recreational forest provides a peaceful and relaxing getaway with lush pine tree forest along with diverse animals and plants. The trees are great for forest bathing, and are beautiful in autumn when the leaves turn crimson. <BR>
Nearby attractions include Suanbo Hot Springs, Songnisan Mountain, Eight Sights of Danyang, and Chungjuho Lake. The park also has log cabins, providing a unique type of accommodation.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Gudambong Peak & Oksunbong Peak (Íµ¨Îã¥Î¥â & Ïò•ÏàúÎ¥â)
dataList.description:
Gudambong Peak and Oksunbong Peak (alt. 372m) are widely known as two of the ‚ÄúEight Scenic Views of Danyang." Gudambong Peak (lit. Turtle Pond Peak) gets its name from the reflection of its rugged cliffs on the lake below, which is said to look like a turtle. Oksunbong Peak (lit. Bamboo Shoot Peak), well known for its magnificent scenery, was so named because its white and mossy rocks stand high like fresh bamboo shoots.

The historic book Yeojiseungnam (Geographical Survey of Korea) describes how Kim Il-son, a civil officer in the Joseon Dynasty, greatly extolled the beauty of its marvelous ravines. Both Gudambong Peak and Oksunbong Peak offer spectacular views of Chungjuho Lake and Geumsusan Mountain.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Gosudonggul Cave (Îã®Ïñë Í≥†ÏàòÎèôÍµ¥)
dataList.description: Designated as a natural monument, Gosudonggul Cave is a limestone cave situated in Danyang, well known for its mystery and beauty. The cave is roughly 1,700 meters long and features stalactites, stalagmites, underground lakes, cave pearls, and other cave formations. Gosudonggul Cave is also home to rare formations such as aragonite. Other unique features are the many rocks with interesting names, such as Lion Rock, Dodamsambong Rock, Virgin Mary Rock, and Love Rock. The cave is a valuable resource for researchers and educators.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Goesanho Lake (Í¥¥ÏÇ∞Ìò∏)
dataList.description: Goesanho Lake is located in the Chilseong-myeon area of Goesan-gun. The lake is abundant in a variety of freshwater fish, which makes it a famous year-round fishing site.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Geumsusan Mountain (Í∏àÏàòÏÇ∞)
dataList.description: Geumsusan Mountain, originally called Baegamsan Mountain, was renamed by noted Joseon-period scholar Yi Hwang (pen name Toegye) when he was the chief governor of Danyang County, saying its graceful features matched the fineness of silk embroidery. The mountain is beautiful throughout the year with bright foliage in fall and an ice cave that stays frozen until early April. The view from the summit of the mountain resembles a pregnant woman lying on her side, and there is a legend that women who pray for a son here will have their wish come true.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Geumgang Resort (Í∏àÍ∞ïÏú†ÏõêÏßÄ)
dataList.description:
Geumgang Resort has become popular thanks to the construction of the Geumgang Service Area. With scenic mountains and a large beautiful lake, this resort attracts many visitors. By crossing a nearby dam, visitors can get to Usan-ri. Recently, many modern homestay facilities have been built in this area, and it has been transformed into a perfect destination for families and young people alike.

Utilize the many facilities of the Geumgang Service Area while relaxing at Geumgang Resort. Also, Joryeong-ri Local Food Village is located across from the Geumgang Service Area, and offers a variety of local foods.
dataList.author: korea-tour
